snippet: Britain is among the countries likely to press for the right to require its banks to hold more capital than the European Union minimum.
abstract: European Union finance ministers are expected to work out details over how much capital the union's 8,300 banks should be required to hold; Britain is likely to be among the countries to press for the right to require their banks to hold more capital than the mandated minimum in an effort to reduce the risk to taxpayers; other countries have argued against allowing governments such latitude to raise requirements.

byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and STEPHEN CASTLE

lead_paragraph: Britain is among the countries likely to press for the right to require its banks to hold more capital than the European Union minimum.

headline.main: European Leaders to Weigh New Capital Requirements for Banks
headline.print_headline: Europe Finance Chiefs Are Divided on Bank Capital Requirements
